PRIVATE EQUITY FUND

FS One Equity Partners

Overview

FS OneEquity Partners Co. L.P. (FS OneEquity) will seek to generate strong, long-term operating results and shareholder value by acquiring, controlling and growing private middle market companies globally. FS OneEquity will provide investors with direct access to the middle marker expertise of Franklin Square Capital Partners (Franklin Square) and One Equity Parners (OEP).

FUND STRATEGY

Private Equity Middle Market

FUND OFFERING SIZE

$2.950 billion

INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES

Long-term capital appreciation

OPERATING COMPANY MODEL

Unlisted, externally managed operating company that will offer investors the opportunity to participate in the ownership and development of private middle market companies.

SPONSORS

FS OneEquity is a join venture between Franklin Square and OEP

MANAGEMENT

Externally managed by FS OneEquity Manager GP, LLC, and affiliate of the sponsors

AQUISITION STRATEGY

Acquire controlling stakes in and operate private middle market companies across the globe

BUSINESS PLAN OVERVIEW

FS OneEquity intends to operate its controlled subsidiaries with an objective of long-term value creation for its shareholders by actively engaging in the management of their businesses, with no pre-determined timeframe for disposition.

JOINT VENTURE PARTNER

One Equity Partners (“OEP”) was founded in 2001 as the private investment arm of Bank One Corporation (“Bank One”) and became the private investment arm of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (“JPMorgan”) in 2004 when Bank One merged with JPMorgan. From 2001 through 2014, OEP invested $11 billion in 73 companies with a focus on partnership with existing owners to realize transformative change in their businesses, often through mergers or other growth-focused primary capital investments.

In early 2015, the OEP team spun-out from JPMorgan and established an independent management company called OEP Capital Advisors, L.P. (“OEP”). The spin-out coincided with JPMorgan’s sale of certain portfolio company investments to Lexington Partners (“Lexington”), Alpinvest Partners (“Alpinvest”) and the Blackstone Group (“Blackstone”). OEP manages the retained portfolio company investments for JPMorgan as well as the sold portfolio company investments to Lexington, Alpinvest and Blackstone. OEP has established its first standalone private equity fund, One Equity Partners VI, L.P. with a core strategy of middle market private equity investments in North America and Western Europe. OEP's investment professionals are based in New York, Chicago, Frankfurt and São Paulo.

About the Firm

Franklin Square’s co-founders, led by Chairman and CEO Michael Forman, started the firm in 2007 with a simple mission: investors should have the same access to alternative investments as large institutional investors. Dissatisfied with the limited alternative investment options available to the investing public, the team spent two years analyzing vaeioua ways to deliver on their mission. This led to a significant breakthrough. Franklin Square took an underutilized investment vehicle called business development company (BDC) and the Investment Company Act of 1940. Franklin Square also selected GSO/Blackstone, one of the largest alternative asset managers in the world, to sub-advise its funds, putting a world-class institutional asset within reach of investors. The result was a new model for income-based investments that has transformed the alternatives landscape.

Disclaimer

Securities offered through FS2 Capital Partners, LLC (member FINRA/SIPC). FS2 Capital Partners, LLC is Franklin Square’s affiliated broker dealer that serves as the wholesaling distributor of FS OneEquity’s common shares (the Shares) representing limited partnership interests of FS OneEquity. The information contained herein is not complete and may be amended or changed. Investors should read and carefully consider all information found in the applicable FS OneEquity private placement memorandum before investing because it contains important information about FS OneEquity, including the risks and expenses related to an investment in FS OneEquity. FS OneEquity is not an investment fund and intends to employ a business model whose success depends upon FS OneEquity’s ability to operate, manage and grow businesses which it acquires.

This is neither an offer to sell nor a solicitation of an offer to buy the securities described herein. An offering may be made only by a private placement memorandum and only to properly qualified accredited investors in compliance with relevant federal and state securities laws.

The Shares have not been and are not expected to be registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the Securities Act), or any state or other securities laws or the laws of any non-U.S. jurisdiction. The Shares will be offered and sold in the United States under the exemption provided by Section 4(a)(2) of the Securities Act and Rule 506 of Regulation D promulgated thereunder (to the extent applicable) and other exemptions of similar import in the laws of the states and other jurisdictions where the offering will be made. There is no obligation on the part of any person to register the Shares under the Securities Act. Franklin Square Capital Partners is not affiliated with Franklin Resources/Franklin Templeton Investments or the Franklin Funds.
